trigger: I’ve had to explain this multiple times.
advice: Acknowledge their effort. Offer a new direction.
cue: I understand — and I appreciate your patience. I’ll take a different approach now.

trigger: Why was I billed again?
advice: Stay factual. Clarify without defensiveness.
cue: Let me explain the charge and how we can resolve it if needed.

trigger: This is ridiculous. I want a manager.
advice: Acknowledge frustration. Offer a path forward or connect to escalation.
cue: I understand your frustration — I can either assist you directly or escalate this for you right now.

trigger: You’re not helping at all.
advice: Shift tone, show solution-oriented mindset.
cue: I hear you — let’s reset and solve this together step-by-step.

trigger: Why does this keep happening?
advice: Explain the root cause. Show ownership.
cue: Great question — here’s why this might be recurring, and what I’ll do differently now.

trigger: Do you even know what you’re doing?
advice: Rebuild trust with calm, evidence, or senior help.
cue: That’s a fair concern — let me walk you through this step-by-step or involve someone senior if needed.

trigger: I’ve tried everything and nothing works.
advice: Skip repeated steps. Offer a new approach.
cue: Sounds like you've been through a lot — let’s try something new that we haven’t done yet.

trigger: Last time someone fixed it for me immediately.
advice: Acknowledge previous experience. Avoid defense.
cue: I’m glad it worked smoothly last time — I’ll aim for the same or better now.

trigger: Your support is useless.
advice: Don’t take it personally. Show action, not apology.
cue: I'm here to turn that around — let me show you exactly how I’ll fix it.

trigger: I’ve been on hold forever.
advice: Validate time lost. Move quickly.
cue: Thanks for your patience — I’ll get this sorted right away.

trigger: No one ever reads the notes.
advice: Prove you’ve read and understood them. Break the pattern.
cue: I’ve reviewed your history, and here’s what we’ll do differently this time.

trigger: This keeps happening over and over.
advice: Explain steps to break the cycle.
cue: You're right — and I’m going to stop that from happening again by doing X.

trigger: It’s working now, but I still don’t get what was wrong.
advice: Explain clearly, don’t brush off.
cue: That’s fair — the issue was likely caused by X. I’m happy to explain more if you’d like.

trigger: I don’t feel heard.
advice: Reflect and validate. Re-engage clearly.
cue: Thanks for saying that — I hear you, and here’s how I’ll make sure you feel supported now.

trigger: It’s not a big deal, but I just wanted to say...
advice: Acknowledge concern with warmth. Don’t dismiss it.
cue: I appreciate you sharing that — it helps us improve.

trigger: I’ve been transferred three times already.
advice: Take ownership. Stop the bounce.
cue: I’m taking responsibility now — we’re solving this together without another transfer.

trigger: Thanks for helping — you’re the first one who actually has.
advice: Affirm and follow through strongly.
cue: That means a lot — let’s make sure we completely fix it.

trigger: Whatever, just cancel it.
advice: Offer one last quick, clear solution without pressure.
cue: Absolutely — before we cancel, I can offer one quick fix that might solve this. Would that be okay?

trigger: This has cost me money/time already.
advice: Acknowledge cost, offer restitution or priority solution.
cue: I understand this has cost you. I’ll prioritize a fix and we can explore compensation after.

trigger: I’m tired of repeating myself.
advice: Show you've heard. Avoid repetition.
cue: Let’s skip repeating and get to resolution. I’ve reviewed everything you’ve said.

trigger: You just lost a customer.
advice: Acknowledge disappointment, offer dignity, don’t beg.
cue: I understand — if you change your mind, I’ll still be here to help.

trigger: I need this fixed today, no excuses.
advice: Commit to steps, not promises. Set boundaries with clarity.
cue: Here’s what I can do today: [brief list]. You’ll have updates before EOD.

trigger: Sorry, I’m just really stressed.
advice: De-escalate. Be emotionally supportive, not clinical.
cue: Totally okay — I’ve got you. Let me take it from here step-by-step.

trigger: This isn’t even your fault, I know.
advice: Appreciate the understanding, then act.
cue: Thanks for understanding — let me still do everything I can to fix it.

trigger: I shouldn’t have to call for this.
advice: Acknowledge the gap, then deliver fast.
cue: You’re right — this should’ve worked without a call. Let me fix it directly now.

trigger: My reservation was canceled without notice.
advice: Apologize and offer immediate rebooking or compensation.
cue: I’m truly sorry about the cancellation — let me check what happened and rebook or make it up to you immediately.

trigger: I was told this item was in stock.
advice: Explain inventory delay and provide alternatives.
cue: I understand the frustration — I’ll double-check availability and suggest a reliable alternative if needed.

trigger: Your technician never showed up.
advice: Apologize and offer urgent rescheduling.
cue: I’m really sorry about the no-show — I’ll reschedule this urgently and follow up to ensure it happens.

trigger: Why is my internet still not working?
advice: Acknowledge repeated issue, offer technical solution.
cue: I know this is frustrating — let’s run a deeper check and fix this right now.

trigger: I never authorized this charge.
advice: Treat seriously, explain next verification steps.
cue: I take that seriously — let me verify your account history and walk you through the next steps.

trigger: This gift card doesn’t work.
advice: Apologize and provide fast solution or refund.
cue: Let’s fix that immediately — I’ll either reactivate the card or issue you a new one.

trigger: The product arrived damaged.
advice: Acknowledge issue and arrange replacement.
cue: That’s unacceptable — I’ll arrange a free replacement and ensure this doesn’t happen again.

trigger: Why did you change my flight?
advice: Explain airline policy and assist rebooking.
cue: I can explain why that happened — and I’ll help you get the best new option right now.

trigger: I canceled, but I wasn’t refunded.
advice: Apologize and confirm cancellation status.
cue: Let me confirm that for you — and if the refund hasn’t been processed, I’ll fix it today.

trigger: My package says delivered but it’s not here.
advice: Check delivery status and offer replacement path.
cue: Let’s track this down — if it’s missing, I’ll immediately start a replacement or refund process.

trigger: My points didn’t apply to this purchase.
advice: Clarify points rules and apply manually if possible.
cue: Let me check your points history — if it qualifies, I’ll get those points applied manually.

trigger: You said I’d get a callback and I didn’t.
advice: Apologize and follow through now.
cue: That’s on us — I’ll personally ensure your issue gets the attention it needs now.

trigger: I’m not paying for something I didn’t use.
advice: Review usage, offer fair options.
cue: Let’s take a fair look — I’ll check your account and walk you through what happened.

trigger: You keep changing the terms.
advice: Clarify policy and offer clear expectations.
cue: I can explain the changes and how they’ll affect you — let’s go over this together.

trigger: I was promised free shipping.
advice: Verify promotion and honor if valid.
cue: Let me check that offer — if you qualify, I’ll ensure you get the free shipping as promised.

trigger: No one told me I needed to confirm.
advice: Explain process clearly and rebook if possible.
cue: That should’ve been clearer — let me help you get rebooked without further hassle.

trigger: My coupon code isn’t working.
advice: Verify code and apply manually if applicable.
cue: Let’s get that working — if it’s valid, I’ll apply the discount manually for you now.

trigger: Your update broke the app.
advice: Reassure, collect issue detail, forward to devs.
cue: I’m sorry this happened — I’ll gather the issue details and get our team on it immediately.

trigger: I got the wrong item.
advice: Apologize and send correct item swiftly.
cue: That’s on us — I’ll send the correct item right away and arrange a return for this one.

trigger: I can’t reset my password.
advice: Guide them step-by-step and ensure reset.
cue: Let’s fix that together — I’ll walk you through resetting it right now.

trigger: You auto-renewed without telling me.
advice: Clarify terms and offer cancellation/refund.
cue: I hear you — let me walk through your renewal terms and help with a refund if needed.

trigger: This agent was rude to me.
advice: Acknowledge, apologize, de-escalate.
cue: I'm really sorry you felt that way — I’ll ensure this is addressed and help resolve your issue myself.

trigger: You messed up my travel plans.
advice: Take ownership and guide through recovery.
cue: I’ll take responsibility and work with you to fix your travel arrangements now.

trigger: I’ve been waiting for a refund for weeks.
advice: Check status and fast-track if overdue.
cue: Let me verify that refund and escalate it immediately if it’s overdue.

trigger: The app keeps logging me out.
advice: Acknowledge and provide quick fix or escalate.
cue: Let’s fix this once and for all — I’ll walk you through a stable solution or report it now.
